deliverables.deliverable: sharing their knowledge, technical expertise and best practices

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Identify and disrupt illicit financial flows
deliverables.deliverable: identify and disrupt illicit financial flows

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the efforts of <<Governments>>, <<United Nations bodies and agencies>> and <<intergovernmental, regional, subregional and non-governmental organizations>> to prevent and address trafficking in women and girls and *invites* them to further enhance their efforts and cooperation, including by [[sharing their knowledge, technical expertise and best practices]] as widely as possible, and *encourages* <<Member States>> to strengthen cooperation among all relevant actors to [[identify and disrupt illicit financial flows]] stemming from trafficking in women and girls;
uncertainties: Mapped 'United Nations bodies and agencies' to UN System; some 'bodies' may also refer to UN Organs. Treated the combined phrase 'intergovernmental, regional, subregional and non-governmental organizations' as three assignee categories (international organizations, regional organizations, NGOs) sharing the same quote. Classified 'identify and disrupt illicit financial flows' under 'analysis' (identification fits well; 'disrupt' is more enforcement-oriented and not perfectly matched by available categories).

text: Takes note with appreciation of the outcome document of the Regional Ministerial Conference on Human Trafficking and Smuggling in the Horn of Africa, known as the Khartoum Declaration, and calls for its effective implementation, including through technical cooperation and capacity-building, by the United Nations and the international community;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Implementation of the Khartoum Declaration
technical cooperation
capacity-building

textWithHighlights: *Takes note with appreciation* of the outcome document of the Regional Ministerial Conference on Human Trafficking and Smuggling in the Horn of Africa, known as the Khartoum Declaration, and *calls for* its [[effective implementation]], including through [[technical cooperation]] and [[capacity-building]], by the <<United Nations>> and the <<international community>>;

text: Encourages the Commission on the Status of Women to consider addressing the needs of, inter alia, women and girls subjected to trafficking in persons at its sixty-ninth and seventieth sessions, within the framework of the priority themes;

assignees.assignee: Commission on the Status of Women

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<Commission on the Status of Women>> to consider addressing the needs of, inter alia, women and girls subjected to trafficking in persons at its sixty-ninth and seventieth sessions, within the framework of the priority themes;

text: Encourages Member States, the United Nations system and other stakeholders to observe the World Day against Trafficking in Persons, in the context of the need to prevent and eliminate trafficking in persons, protect the rights and dignity of victims and promote the empowerment of survivors of trafficking in persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Observance of World Day against Trafficking in Persons
deliverables.deliverable: observe the World Day against Trafficking in Persons

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>>, the <<United Nations system>> and other stakeholders to [[observe the World Day against Trafficking in Persons]], in the context of the need to prevent and eliminate trafficking in persons, protect the rights and dignity of victims and promote the empowerment of survivors of trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: "other stakeholders" is not captured as an assignee due to lack of specificity. The deliverable is categorized as information_sharing since observing an international day primarily involves awareness-raising activities.

text: Encourages the United Nations system to mainstream, as appropriate, the issue of trafficking in persons, especially trafficking in women and girls, into its broader policies and programmes aimed at addressing economic and social development, human rights, the rule of law, good governance, education, health, humanitarian action, natural disasters, conflict situations and post-conflict reconstruction, and the contributions of women to peacebuilding, peacekeeping and conflict resolution;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Mainstream trafficking in persons into policies and programmes

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<United Nations system>> to [[mainstream]], as appropriate, the issue of trafficking in persons, especially trafficking in women and girls, into its broader policies and programmes aimed at addressing economic and social development, human rights, the rule of law, good governance, education, health, humanitarian action, natural disasters, conflict situations and post-conflict reconstruction, and the contributions of women to peacebuilding, peacekeeping and conflict resolution;

text: Welcomes the continued focus given by the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women) to ending violence against women and girls and to increasing women’s equal access to economic opportunities, as well as its work on building effective partnerships for the empowerment of women and girls, which will contribute to the efforts to combat trafficking in persons;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women)

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the continued focus given by the {{United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women)}} to ending violence against women and girls and to increasing women’s equal access to economic opportunities, as well as its work on building effective partnerships for the empowerment of women and girls, which will contribute to the efforts to combat trafficking in persons;

text: Calls upon Governments to intensify their efforts to prevent and address, with a view to eliminating, the demand that fosters the trafficking of women and girls for all forms of exploitation and in this regard to put in place or to enhance preventive measures, including legislative and punitive measures to deter traffickers and exploiters of trafficked persons, as well as ensure their accountability;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: preventive measures
legislative and punitive measures

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> to intensify their efforts to prevent and address, with a view to eliminating, the demand that fosters the trafficking of women and girls for all forms of exploitation and in this regard to put in place or to enhance [[preventive measures]], including [[legislative and punitive measures]] to deter traffickers and exploiters of trafficked persons, as well as ensure their accountability;
uncertainties: Mapped “Governments” to Member States. Classified “legislative and punitive measures” under legislation, though punitive measures may also imply enforcement/policy actions.

text: Recalls the basic principles on the right to an effective remedy for victims of trafficking in persons and encourages States to ensure the full recovery and well-being of trafficking victims through long-term, comprehensive reintegration support, including legal, economic, health, psychological and social support, including migration support, as appropriate;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: reintegration support for trafficking victims

textWithHighlights: *Recalls* the basic principles on the right to an effective remedy for victims of trafficking in persons and *encourages* <<States>> to ensure the full recovery and well-being of trafficking victims through long-term, comprehensive [[reintegration support]], including legal, economic, health, psychological and social support, including migration support, as appropriate;
uncertainties: Classified 'reintegration support' as humanitarian assistance; could also be interpreted as social services or victim support outside emergency contexts.

text: Calls upon Governments to strengthen measures aimed at achieving gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls and their equal and full enjoyment of all human rights, women’s full, equal and meaningful participation in all spheres of life, free from all forms of discrimination and violence, and their leadership in society, including through education, economic empowerment, gender-sensitive social protection and promoting an increase in the number of women assuming decision-making roles in both the public and private sectors, to take further appropriate measures to address the increasing rate of homelessness of and inadequate housing for women and girls in order to reduce their risk of being trafficked and, in that regard, to improve the collection and use of disaggregated data and gender statistics to inform such measures;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Improve collection and use of disaggregated gender data and statistics
deliverables.deliverable: improve the collection and use of disaggregated data and gender statistics

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> to strengthen measures aimed at achieving gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls and their equal and full enjoyment of all human rights, women’s full, equal and meaningful participation in all spheres of life, free from all forms of discrimination and violence, and their leadership in society, including through education, economic empowerment, gender-sensitive social protection and promoting an increase in the number of women assuming decision-making roles in both the public and private sectors, to take further appropriate measures to address the increasing rate of homelessness of and inadequate housing for women and girls in order to reduce their risk of being trafficked and, in that regard, to [[improve the collection and use of disaggregated data and gender statistics]] to inform such measures;

text: Also calls upon Governments to take appropriate preventive measures to address the underlying causes and factors that increase the risk of trafficking in persons, such as poverty, including the feminization of poverty, underdevelopment and lack of economic opportunities, gender inequality, gender stereotypes and negative social norms, discrimination, gender-based violence, violence against women and girls, impunity for such violence, persistent demand that fosters all forms of trafficking and the goods and services produced as a result of such trafficking, as well as other factors that encourage trafficking of women for all forms of sexual abuse and exploitation, including in prostitution, pornography and other forms of commercialized sex, forced marriage, forced labour and organ removal, as well as trafficking of girls for child sexual abuse and exploitation, child, early and forced marriage, forced labour and sale of children, including in the context of exploitative commercial surrogacy, and encourages Governments to enact or strengthen legislation, with a view to preventing and eliminating trafficking in persons, providing better protection of the rights of women and girls and punishing perpetrators, including public officials engaging in or facilitating trafficking in persons, through, as appropriate, criminal, civil and administrative measures;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Legislation to prevent and eliminate trafficking in persons

textWithHighlights: Also *calls upon* <<Governments>> to take appropriate preventive measures to address the underlying causes and factors that increase the risk of trafficking in persons, such as poverty, including the feminization of poverty, underdevelopment and lack of economic opportunities, gender inequality, gender stereotypes and negative social norms, discrimination, gender-based violence, violence against women and girls, impunity for such violence, persistent demand that fosters all forms of trafficking and the goods and services produced as a result of such trafficking, as well as other factors that encourage trafficking of women for all forms of sexual abuse and exploitation, including in prostitution, pornography and other forms of commercialized sex, forced marriage, forced labour and organ removal, as well as trafficking of girls for child sexual abuse and exploitation, child, early and forced marriage, forced labour and sale of children, including in the context of exploitative commercial surrogacy, and *encourages* <<Governments>> to enact or strengthen [[legislation]], with a view to preventing and eliminating trafficking in persons, providing better protection of the rights of women and girls and punishing perpetrators, including public officials engaging in or facilitating trafficking in persons, through, as appropriate, criminal, civil and administrative measures;

text: Calls upon Governments, the international community and all other organizations and entities that deal with conflict, post-conflict, disaster and other emergency situations to address the heightened risk of women and girls to trafficking in persons and exploitation and associated gender-based violence, inter alia, that is perpetuated by traffickers in digital spaces or through the use of technology, and to prevent the trafficking of affected women and girls through national, regional and international initiatives;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>>, the <<international community>> and all other organizations and entities that deal with conflict, post-conflict, disaster and other emergency situations to address the heightened risk of women and girls to trafficking in persons and exploitation and associated gender-based violence, inter alia, that is perpetuated by traffickers in digital spaces or through the use of technology, and to prevent the trafficking of affected women and girls through national, regional and international initiatives;
uncertainties: Did not extract a deliverable because the tasks ('address the heightened risk' and 'prevent trafficking through initiatives') are broad and not concrete. Also did not include 'all other organizations and entities...' as assignees due to lack of specificity.

text: Urges Governments to devise, enforce and strengthen effective gender-responsive and age-sensitive measures to combat and eliminate all forms of trafficking in women and girls, including for sexual and economic exploitation, as part of a comprehensive anti-trafficking strategy that integrates a human rights perspective, and to draw up, as appropriate, national action plans in this regard;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Gender-responsive and age-sensitive anti-trafficking measures
National action plans on trafficking in women and girls

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Governments>> to devise, enforce and strengthen effective gender-responsive and age-sensitive [[measures]] to combat and eliminate all forms of trafficking in women and girls, including for sexual and economic exploitation, as part of a comprehensive anti-trafficking strategy that integrates a human rights perspective, and to draw up, as appropriate, [[national action plans]] in this regard;

text: Also urges Governments to ensure that the prevention of and responses to trafficking in persons continue to address the specific needs of women and girls and their participation in and contribution to all phases of preventing and responding to trafficking in persons, especially in addressing specific forms of exploitation, such as sexual exploitation, and, in this regard, to ensure women’s full, equal and meaningful participation in decision-making at all levels, inter alia, in the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of anti-trafficking legislation, policy and programmes, continuing implementation of the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime and the Trafficking Protocol thereto, as an essential component of the peacemaking, stabilization and reconstruction process;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Implementation of the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime and the Trafficking in Persons Protocol

textWithHighlights: Also *urges* <<Governments>> to ensure that the prevention of and responses to trafficking in persons continue to address the specific needs of women and girls and their participation in and contribution to all phases of preventing and responding to trafficking in persons, especially in addressing specific forms of exploitation, such as sexual exploitation, and, in this regard, to ensure women’s full, equal and meaningful participation in decision-making at all levels, inter alia, in the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of anti-trafficking legislation, policy and programmes, continuing [[implementation]] of the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime and the Trafficking Protocol thereto, as an essential component of the peacemaking, stabilization and reconstruction process;
uncertainties: Considered but excluded as deliverables (to remain conservative): ensuring participation of women and girls in decision-making and in the development/implementation/monitoring/evaluation of anti-trafficking laws, policies and programmes, since the operative request focuses on ensuring participation rather than mandating those processes themselves.

text: Further urges Governments, in cooperation with intergovernmental, non-governmental and private sector organizations, to support and allocate resources to strengthen preventive action, in particular, education for all, on human rights, gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, self-respect and mutual respect, and campaigns carried out in collaboration with civil society and the private sector to increase public awareness of the issue at the national and grass-roots levels, including awareness-raising campaigns against trafficking in persons and slavery, including modern slavery, targeted at groups that are at increased risk of becoming victims of trafficking in persons, as well as at those who may fuel the demand that contributes to trafficking in persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: financial resources
education for all
awareness-raising campaigns

textWithHighlights: *Further urges* <<Governments>>, in cooperation with intergovernmental, non-governmental and private sector organizations, to support and [[allocate resources]] to strengthen preventive action, in particular, [[education for all]], on human rights, gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls, self-respect and mutual respect, and campaigns carried out in collaboration with {{civil society}} and the {{private sector}} to increase public awareness of the issue at the national and grass-roots levels, including [[awareness-raising campaigns]] against trafficking in persons and slavery, including modern slavery, targeted at groups that are at increased risk of becoming victims of trafficking in persons, as well as at those who may fuel the demand that contributes to trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: Education for all could be categorized as capacity building or information sharing; chose capacity building. Did not mark intergovernmental/non-governmental organizations at the start as mentioned entities to avoid complex split; captured civil society and private sector later in the sentence.

text: Reiterates the importance of continued coordination among, inter alia, the Special Rapporteurs of the Human Rights Council on trafficking in persons, especially women and children, on the sale, sexual exploitation and abuse of children, and on contemporary forms of slavery, including its causes and consequences, in order to avoid unnecessary duplication in their activities in the fulfilment of their mandates;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* the importance of continued coordination among, inter alia, the {{Special Rapporteurs}} of the {{Human Rights Council}} on trafficking in persons, especially women and children, on the sale, sexual exploitation and abuse of children, and on contemporary forms of slavery, including its causes and consequences, in order to avoid unnecessary duplication in their activities in the fulfilment of their mandates;

text: Urges Governments to strengthen measures to eliminate sex tourism demand, especially for children, through all possible preventive actions, including legislative and punitive measures and other relevant policies and programmes, and to develop age-appropriate educational and training programmes and policies aimed at preventing sex tourism and trafficking in persons, as well as ensuring accountability for perpetrators, giving special emphasis to the protection of young women and children;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Legislative and punitive measures
Educational and training programmes
Policies to prevent sex tourism and trafficking in persons

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Governments>> to strengthen measures to eliminate sex tourism demand, especially for children, through all possible preventive actions, including [[legislative and punitive measures]] and other relevant policies and programmes, and to develop age-appropriate [[educational and training programmes]] and [[policies]] aimed at preventing sex tourism and trafficking in persons, as well as ensuring accountability for perpetrators, giving special emphasis to the protection of young women and children;

text: Reaffirms the central role of the work of the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime in the global fight against trafficking in persons, particularly in providing technical assistance to Member States, upon their request, to implement the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women and Children;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the central role of the work of the {{United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime}} in the global fight against trafficking in persons, particularly in providing technical assistance to {{Member States}}, upon their request, to implement the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women and Children;

text: Calls upon Member States to take into consideration the challenges presented by new methods of profiling, targeting, recruiting, controlling and exploiting victims of trafficking in persons, such as the misuse of the Internet, social media, online platforms, the blockchain and other digital tools and technology, including artificial intelligence, by criminals, to take measures to develop targeted awareness-raising campaigns, including for law enforcement, front-line service providers and at-risk industries, to identify the signs of trafficking in persons, and to develop specialized training for law enforcement and criminal justice practitioners;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: awareness-raising campaigns
specialized training

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Member States>> to take into consideration the challenges presented by new methods of profiling, targeting, recruiting, controlling and exploiting victims of trafficking in persons, such as the misuse of the Internet, social media, online platforms, the blockchain and other digital tools and technology, including artificial intelligence, by criminals, to take measures to develop [[targeted awareness-raising campaigns]], including for law enforcement, front-line service providers and at-risk industries, to identify the signs of trafficking in persons, and to develop [[specialized training]] for law enforcement and criminal justice practitioners;
uncertainties: Did not mark “identify the signs of trafficking in persons” as a separate deliverable, considering it an objective of the campaigns/training rather than a concrete standalone deliverable.

text: Encourages Member States to establish or strengthen national programmes and to engage in bilateral, subregional, regional and international cooperation, including by forging regional initiatives or plans of action, to address the problem of trafficking in persons through, inter alia, enhancing information-sharing, between and among Member States and intergovernmental bodies, such as the International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL), collecting data disaggregated by income, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts, specific data collection and other technical capacities and mutual legal assistance, coordinating with a view to dismantling criminal networks involved in trafficking women and girls, and combating corruption and the laundering of proceeds derived from trafficking in persons, including by collaborating with financial institutions, and to ensure, as appropriate, that such agreements, programmes and initiatives are particularly responsive to the problem of trafficking in persons as it affects women and girls;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: national programmes
regional initiatives
plans of action
information-sharing
disaggregated data collection
technical capacities

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>> to establish or strengthen [[national programmes]] and to engage in bilateral, subregional, regional and international cooperation, including by forging [[regional initiatives]] or [[plans of action]], to address the problem of trafficking in persons through, inter alia, enhancing [[information-sharing]], between and among Member States and intergovernmental bodies, such as the {{International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL)}}, [[collecting data]] disaggregated by income, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts, specific data collection and other [[technical capacities]] and mutual legal assistance, coordinating with a view to dismantling criminal networks involved in trafficking women and girls, and combating corruption and the laundering of proceeds derived from trafficking in persons, including by collaborating with financial institutions, and to ensure, as appropriate, that such agreements, programmes and initiatives are particularly responsive to the problem of trafficking in persons as it affects women and girls;

text: Urges all Governments to criminalize all forms of trafficking in persons, recognizing its increasing occurrence for the purpose of the exploitation of the prostitution of others or other forms of sexual exploitation, forced labour or services, slavery or practices similar to slavery, servitude or the removal of organs, as well as for the purpose of commercial sexual exploitation and abuse and sex tourism, and to bring to justice and punish the offenders and intermediaries involved, including public officials involved with trafficking in persons, whether local or foreign, through the competent national authorities, either in the country of origin of the offender or in the country in which the abuse occurs, in accordance with the due process of law, as well as to penalize persons in authority found guilty of sexually assaulting victims of trafficking in persons in their custody;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Criminalization of all forms of trafficking in persons
deliverables.deliverable: criminalize all forms of trafficking in persons

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Prosecution and punishment of traffickers and intermediaries
Penalization of persons in authority guilty of sexual assault of trafficking victims

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<all Governments>> to [[criminalize all forms of trafficking in persons]], recognizing its increasing occurrence for the purpose of the exploitation of the prostitution of others or other forms of sexual exploitation, forced labour or services, slavery or practices similar to slavery, servitude or the removal of organs, as well as for the purpose of commercial sexual exploitation and abuse and sex tourism, and to [[bring to justice and punish]] the offenders and intermediaries involved, including public officials involved with trafficking in persons, whether local or foreign, through the competent national authorities, either in the country of origin of the offender or in the country in which the abuse occurs, in accordance with the due process of law, as well as to [[penalize persons in authority]] found guilty of sexually assaulting victims of trafficking in persons in their custody;
uncertainties: The actions to bring offenders to justice/punish and to penalize abusive authorities are enforcement measures; there is no exact deliverable category for enforcement, so they are categorized under 'policy' here.

text: Urges Governments, in accordance with their respective legal systems, to take all appropriate measures, including through policies and legislation, to facilitate access to justice and protection for victims of trafficking in persons that is not conditional on their participation in criminal proceedings, as well as to ensure that victims of trafficking in persons are protected from prosecution or punishment for acts those victims have been compelled to commit as a direct consequence of having been subjected to trafficking in persons and that the victims do not suffer from revictimization as a result of actions taken by Government authorities, and encourages Governments to prevent, within their legal framework and in accordance with national policies, victims of trafficking in persons from being prosecuted or punished as a direct consequence of their illegal entry or residence;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Policies to facilitate access to justice and protection
Legislation to facilitate access to justice and protection
Access to justice and protection for trafficking victims
Protection from prosecution or punishment for compelled acts
Prevention of revictimization by Government authorities
Prevention of prosecution or punishment for illegal entry or residence of trafficking victims
deliverables.deliverable: prosecuted or punished as a direct consequence of their illegal entry or residence

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Governments>>, in accordance with their respective legal systems, to take all appropriate measures, including through [[policies]] and [[legislation]], to facilitate [[access to justice and protection]] for victims of trafficking in persons that is not conditional on their participation in criminal proceedings, as well as to ensure that victims of trafficking in persons are [[protected from prosecution or punishment]] for acts those victims have been compelled to commit as a direct consequence of having been subjected to trafficking in persons and that the victims do not suffer from [[revictimization]] as a result of actions taken by {{Government authorities}}, and *encourages* <<Governments>> to prevent, within their legal framework and in accordance with national policies, victims of trafficking in persons from being [[prosecuted or punished as a direct consequence of their illegal entry or residence]];
uncertainties: Classifying outcomes like access to justice/protection and prevention of revictimization as 'policy' deliverables is somewhat interpretive; they could also be implemented through legislation. 'Government authorities' are included as a mentioned entity under 'other' though not in the predefined list.

text: Invites Governments to consider establishing or strengthening a national mechanism, with the participation of civil society, as appropriate, including non-governmental organizations, such as women’s and women’s rights organizations, youth-led organizations, faith-based organizations, migrant and diaspora organizations, and survivors of trafficking in persons, and where appropriate, their families, to ensure a holistic and coordinated approach to anti-trafficking policies and measures, with full respect for human rights, to encourage the exchange of information and to report on data, underlying causes, factors and trends in trafficking in persons, especially trafficking in women and girls, and to include data on victims of trafficking in persons disaggregated by, when feasible, income, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: National anti-trafficking coordination mechanism
Information exchange
Report on trafficking data and trends

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<Governments>> to consider establishing or strengthening a [[national mechanism]], with the participation of {{civil society}}, as appropriate, including {{non-governmental organizations}}, such as women’s and women’s rights organizations, youth-led organizations, faith-based organizations, migrant and diaspora organizations, and {{survivors of trafficking in persons}}, and where appropriate, their {{families}}, to ensure a holistic and coordinated approach to anti-trafficking policies and measures, with full respect for human rights, to encourage the [[exchange of information]] and to [[report on data]], underlying causes, factors and trends in trafficking in persons, especially trafficking in women and girls, and to include data on victims of trafficking in persons disaggregated by, when feasible, income, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts;
uncertainties: Considered whether to extract a separate deliverable for including disaggregated data in reports; treated it as part of the reporting requirement to stay conservative. Also, "consider establishing or strengthening" is less concrete than a direct instruction, but the core deliverable is the establishment/strengthening of a national mechanism.

text: Invites the Special Rapporteur on trafficking in persons, especially women and children, to continue to cooperate with international, regional and national mechanisms to combat trafficking in persons, in consultation with Governments, relevant treaty bodies, special procedures, the specialized agencies, intergovernmental organizations, Indigenous Peoples, civil society, including non-governmental organizations, national human rights institutions, the private sector and other sources, including victims of trafficking in persons or their representatives, as appropriate;

assignees.assignee_normalized: Special Rapporteur on trafficking in persons, especially women and children
assignees.assignee: Special Rapporteur on trafficking in persons, especially women and children

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: cooperation with mechanisms to combat trafficking in persons
consultations with stakeholders

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: victims of trafficking in persons or their representatives

textWithHighlights: *Invites* the <<Special Rapporteur on trafficking in persons, especially women and children>>, to continue to [[cooperate]] with international, regional and national mechanisms to combat trafficking in persons, in [[consultation]] with {{Governments}}, {{relevant treaty bodies}}, {{special procedures}}, {{the specialized agencies}}, {{intergovernmental organizations}}, {{Indigenous Peoples}}, {{civil society}}, including {{non-governmental organizations}}, {{national human rights institutions}}, {{the private sector}} and other sources, including {{victims of trafficking in persons or their representatives}}, as appropriate;
uncertainties: Mapped 'cooperate' and 'consultation' to information_sharing as the closest category; cooperation/consultation are coordination/communication activities rather than meetings. Classified the Special Rapporteur as 'other' since special rapporteurs are independent experts under HRC and not explicitly listed. Normalized 'the specialized agencies' to 'UN agencies' (generic group). 'relevant treaty bodies' and 'special procedures' are treated as 'other' mentioned entities due to lack of specific entries in the list.

text: Calls upon Governments and relevant United Nations bodies to take appropriate measures to raise public awareness on addressing the root causes that lead to all forms of exploitation of at-risk women and girls, in particular those in vulnerable situations, to eliminate the demand that fosters all forms of exploitation, including sexual exploitation and forced labour, to publicize the laws, regulations and penalties relating to this issue and to emphasize that trafficking is a serious crime;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Public awareness on root causes of exploitation
Eliminate demand fostering exploitation
Publicize laws, regulations and penalties
Emphasize trafficking is a serious crime

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> and relevant <<United Nations bodies>> to take appropriate measures to [[raise public awareness]] on addressing the root causes that lead to all forms of exploitation of at-risk women and girls, in particular those in vulnerable situations, to [[eliminate the demand]] that fosters all forms of exploitation, including sexual exploitation and forced labour, to [[publicize]] the laws, regulations and penalties relating to this issue and to [[emphasize]] that trafficking is a serious crime;
uncertainties: Normalized assignee for 'relevant United Nations bodies' interpreted broadly as 'UN System'. Classification of 'eliminate the demand' as a concrete deliverable (policy) is somewhat aspirational but treated as a requested outcome.

text: Calls upon Governments to allocate resources, as appropriate, to provide access to appropriate programmes for the physical, psychological and social recovery of victims of trafficking in persons, including sexual and reproductive healthcare services that include affordable treatment, care and support services for HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted infections, free of stigma and discrimination, as well as comprehensive information and voluntary counselling, and to take measures to cooperate with intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations to provide for the social, medical and psychological care of the victims in ways that protect their privacy and identity;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: financial resources
social, medical and psychological care for victims

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>> to [[allocate resources]], as appropriate, to provide access to appropriate programmes for the physical, psychological and social recovery of victims of trafficking in persons, including sexual and reproductive healthcare services that include affordable treatment, care and support services for HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted infections, free of stigma and discrimination, as well as comprehensive information and voluntary counselling, and to take measures to cooperate with intergovernmental and {{non-governmental organizations}} to provide for the [[social, medical and psychological care]] of the victims in ways that protect their privacy and identity;
uncertainties: The phrase "intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations" is conjunctive; only "non-governmental organizations" was annotated as a mentioned entity because "intergovernmental organizations" does not appear verbatim as a complete phrase to highlight. The cooperation aspect was not treated as a separate deliverable due to its vagueness.

text: Also calls upon Governments to promote the empowerment of women and girls, including survivors of trafficking in persons, in all stages of humanitarian response and to work to provide adequate access to redress;
textWithHighlights: Also *calls upon* <<Governments>> to promote the empowerment of women and girls, including survivors of trafficking in persons, in all stages of humanitarian response and to work to provide adequate access to redress;
uncertainties: Considered but did not extract a deliverable for 'provide adequate access to redress' due to vagueness; it describes a desired outcome rather than a concrete, actionable deliverable under the given categories.

text: Encourages Governments, in line with their obligations under international law, to prevent, combat and eradicate trafficking in persons in the context of international migration, including by identifying and supporting victims of trafficking in persons, to prevent the criminalization of migrants who are victims of trafficking for trafficking related offences, and to cooperate with relevant stakeholders to undertake or strengthen campaigns to inform migrants, including migrant women and girls, of the risks associated with trafficking in persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Awareness campaigns informing migrants about trafficking risks

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Governments>>, in line with their obligations under international law, to prevent, combat and eradicate trafficking in persons in the context of international migration, including by identifying and supporting victims of trafficking in persons, to prevent the criminalization of migrants who are victims of trafficking for trafficking related offences, and to cooperate with relevant stakeholders to undertake or strengthen [[campaigns]] to inform migrants, including migrant women and girls, of the risks associated with trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: Considered extracting 'identifying and supporting victims' as a deliverable, but excluded as it is broad/operational rather than a discrete deliverable under the provided categories.

text: Strongly urges Governments to ensure coherence between the laws on and measures responding to migration, labour and trafficking in persons to respect, protect and promote the human rights of migrant women and girls throughout the migration and employment process as well as the repatriation process, when applicable, and to provide effective protection against trafficking in persons;
textWithHighlights: *Strongly urges* <<Governments>> to ensure coherence between the laws on and measures responding to migration, labour and trafficking in persons to respect, protect and promote the human rights of migrant women and girls throughout the migration and employment process as well as the repatriation process, when applicable, and to provide effective protection against trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: Considered but did not extract deliverables such as 'ensure coherence' or 'provide effective protection' as they are not sufficiently concrete per guidelines.

text: Invites States, together with relevant United Nations entities, to undertake further research into the links between migration and trafficking in persons to guide the development of age-sensitive and gender-responsive policies and programmes that address the vulnerability of women and girl migrants;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Research into links between migration and trafficking in persons

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<States>>, together with relevant <<United Nations entities>>, to undertake [[further research]] into the links between migration and trafficking in persons to guide the development of age-sensitive and gender-responsive policies and programmes that address the vulnerability of women and girl migrants;

text: Encourages Governments to review and strengthen, as appropriate, the enforcement of relevant labour and other laws within their territories or jurisdictions that are aimed at, or have the effect of, requiring business enterprises, including recruitment agencies, to prevent and combat trafficking in persons in supply chains, and to periodically assess the adequacy of such laws and address any gaps;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Review enforcement of relevant laws
Strengthen enforcement of relevant laws
Periodic assessment of adequacy of relevant laws

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Governments>> to [[review]] and [[strengthen]], as appropriate, the enforcement of relevant labour and other laws within their territories or jurisdictions that are aimed at, or have the effect of, requiring {{business enterprises}}, including {{recruitment agencies}}, to prevent and combat trafficking in persons in supply chains, and to [[periodically assess]] the adequacy of such laws and address any gaps;
uncertainties: Did not extract 'address any gaps' as a deliverable because it is vague.

text: Encourages the business sector to adopt ethical codes of conduct to ensure decent work and to prevent any form of exploitative practices that foster trafficking in persons, taking into account the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: ethical codes of conduct

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<business sector>> to adopt [[ethical codes of conduct]] to ensure decent work and to prevent any form of exploitative practices that foster trafficking in persons, taking into account the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights;
uncertainties: Normalized assignee set to 'private sector'. Deliverable categorized as 'standards' (could also be seen as 'policy' in some contexts).

text: Encourages Governments to intensify collaboration with non-governmental organizations, including women’s and women’s rights organizations, to develop and implement gender-responsive and age-sensitive programmes for effective counselling, training and reintegration into society of victims of trafficking in persons and programmes that provide shelter and helplines to victims or potential victims in ways that protect their privacy and identity, ensuring that all these programs are sensitive to the needs of persons with disabilities;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Gender-responsive and age-sensitive programmes for counselling, training and reintegration of trafficking victims
Shelter for victims or potential victims of trafficking
Helplines for victims or potential victims of trafficking

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Governments>> to intensify collaboration with {{non-governmental organizations}}, including {{women’s and women’s rights organizations}}, to develop and implement gender-responsive and age-sensitive [[programmes]] for effective counselling, training and reintegration into society of victims of trafficking in persons and programmes that provide [[shelter]] and [[helplines]] to victims or potential victims in ways that protect their privacy and identity, ensuring that all these programs are sensitive to the needs of persons with disabilities;
uncertainties: Categorization choices: treating “programmes” as policy; “shelter” as humanitarian assistance; and “helplines” as infrastructure (could also be seen as information/communication services).

text: Urges Governments to provide or strengthen training for, and to raise awareness among, law enforcement, judicial, immigration, health and other relevant officials on the prevention and combating of trafficking in persons, including the sexual exploitation of women and girls, and in this regard calls upon Governments to ensure that the treatment of victims of trafficking in persons, especially by law enforcement officials, immigration officers, consular officials, social workers, health service providers and other first response officials, is victim-centred and trauma-informed and conducted with full respect for the human rights of those victims and with gender and age sensitivity and observes the principles of non-discrimination;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Training for officials on preventing and combating trafficking in persons
Awareness-raising among officials on preventing and combating trafficking in persons
Ensure victim-centred, trauma-informed treatment of trafficking victims
Observance of non-discrimination principles in treatment of trafficking victims

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Governments>> to provide or strengthen [[training]] for, and to [[raise awareness]] among, law enforcement, judicial, immigration, health and other relevant officials on the prevention and combating of trafficking in persons, including the sexual exploitation of women and girls, and in this regard *calls upon* <<Governments>> to ensure that the treatment of victims of trafficking in persons, especially by law enforcement officials, immigration officers, consular officials, social workers, health service providers and other first response officials, is [[victim-centred and trauma-informed]] and conducted with full respect for the human rights of those victims and with gender and age sensitivity and observes the [[principles of non-discrimination]];
uncertainties: Classified the 'ensure treatment is victim-centred and trauma-informed' and 'observes principles of non-discrimination' as standards; could be seen as policy/standards. No additional mentioned entities were captured since officials are roles rather than listed entities.

text: Encourages Member States to provide training and equip law enforcement and border control officials, as well as medical personnel, with necessary skills and abilities in identifying potential cases of trafficking in persons for the purpose of organ removal;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: training for officials
skills development for officials

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>> to provide [[training]] and equip law enforcement and border control officials, as well as medical personnel, with necessary [[skills and abilities]] in identifying potential cases of trafficking in persons for the purpose of organ removal;

text: Invites Governments to take steps to ensure that criminal justice procedures and witness protection programmes are responsive to the particular situation of women and girls subjected to trafficking, and that they are supported and assisted, as appropriate, in making complaints to the police or other authorities, without fear and with due regard for the protection of their privacy and their identity, and are available, when required, to the criminal justice system, and to ensure that during this time they have access to gender-, disability- and age-sensitive protection and, as appropriate, social, medical, financial and legal assistance, including the possibility of obtaining compensation for damages suffered;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Responsive criminal justice procedures
Responsive witness protection programmes
Assistance to victims to make complaints
Access to victim protection
Access to social, medical, financial and legal assistance
deliverables.deliverable: social, medical, financial and legal assistance

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Compensation for damages suffered

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<Governments>> to take steps to ensure that [[criminal justice procedures]] and [[witness protection programmes]] are responsive to the particular situation of women and girls subjected to trafficking, and that they are supported and assisted, as appropriate, in [[making complaints]] to the police or other authorities, without fear and with due regard for the protection of their privacy and their identity, and are available, when required, to the criminal justice system, and to ensure that during this time they have access to gender-, disability- and age-sensitive [[protection]] and, as appropriate, [[social, medical, financial and legal assistance]], including the possibility of obtaining [[compensation]] for damages suffered;
uncertainties: Classifying the broad set of victim services (social, medical, financial, legal) under a single category is approximate; some elements could also fit financial_resources (financial assistance) or technical_assistance (legal aid).

text: Emphasizes the need to establish firewalls between immigration checks and labour inspections, and/or to ensure that labour inspections are conducted in such a way that does not put potential victims of trafficking in fear of immigration authorities or offences;
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the need to establish firewalls between immigration checks and labour inspections, and/or to ensure that labour inspections are conducted in such a way that does not put potential victims of trafficking in fear of immigration authorities or offences;

text: Invites Governments to intensify efforts aimed at the efficient prosecution and speedy disposition of cases of trafficking in persons, ensuring non-discrimination between men and women offenders, and, in cooperation with, inter alia, intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations, to devise, enforce and strengthen systems and mechanisms for combating trafficking in persons, bearing in mind that criminal network members may be exploiting women and girls to evade accountability, and that trafficked women and girls should not be subjected to unjust prosecution in countries of destination in relation to their being trafficked, instead of the criminal network members;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Systems and mechanisms to combat trafficking in persons

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<Governments>> to intensify efforts aimed at the efficient prosecution and speedy disposition of cases of trafficking in persons, ensuring non-discrimination between men and women offenders, and, in cooperation with, inter alia, {{intergovernmental}} and {{non-governmental organizations}}, to devise, enforce and strengthen [[systems and mechanisms]] for combating trafficking in persons, bearing in mind that criminal network members may be exploiting women and girls to evade accountability, and that trafficked women and girls should not be subjected to unjust prosecution in countries of destination in relation to their being trafficked, instead of the criminal network members;
uncertainties: Classified 'systems and mechanisms' under 'policy'; could arguably be 'infrastructure'. Highlighting 'intergovernmental' alone follows guidance for split phrases (as in 'international and regional organizations').

text: Encourages Governments to develop and implement strategies that promote safe access to the use of media and to information and communications technologies, including for women and girls, to require media providers, including Internet, social media and online platform service providers, to adopt or strengthen measures to promote the safe and responsible use of media, particularly the Internet, social media and online platforms, with a view to eliminating the exploitation of women and children, particularly girls, and to prevent and eradicate trafficking in women and girls, including through increasing women’s and girls’ digital literacy and access to information;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strategies for safe media and ICT access
Measures for safe and responsible media use
Increase women’s and girls’ digital literacy
Increase women’s and girls’ access to information

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Governments>> to develop and implement [[strategies]] that promote safe access to the use of media and to information and communications technologies, including for women and girls, to require {{media providers}}, including Internet, social media and online platform service providers, to adopt or strengthen [[measures]] to promote the safe and responsible use of media, particularly the Internet, social media and online platforms, with a view to eliminating the exploitation of women and children, particularly girls, and to prevent and eradicate trafficking in women and girls, including through increasing women’s and girls’ [[digital literacy]] and [[access to information]];
uncertainties: Classifying “access to information” as information_sharing could alternatively be seen as policy or infrastructure; media providers are generalized to the private sector as a mentioned entity.

text: Encourages the business sector, in particular the tourism, travel and telecommunications industries, relevant recruitment agencies and mass media organizations, to cooperate with Governments in eliminating trafficking in women and children, in particular girls, including through the dissemination by the media of information regarding the dangers of trafficking in persons, the means used by traffickers, the rights of persons subjected to trafficking in persons and the services available to them;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: dissemination of information on trafficking in persons
deliverables.deliverable: dissemination by the media of information

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<business sector>>, in particular the <<tourism, travel and telecommunications industries>>, <<relevant recruitment agencies>> and <<mass media organizations>>, to cooperate with {{Governments}} in eliminating trafficking in women and children, in particular girls, including through the [[dissemination by the media of information]] regarding the dangers of trafficking in persons, the means used by traffickers, the rights of persons subjected to trafficking in persons and the services available to them;

text: Stresses the need for the systematic collection of disaggregated data including, as appropriate, in humanitarian responses, in line with do-no-harm principles, and in this regard takes note of the publication of the Global Report on Trafficking in Persons, prepared by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, and the development of common methodologies and internationally defined indicators to make it possible to develop relevant and comparable figures, and encourages Governments to enhance information-sharing and data-collection capacity as a way of promoting cooperation to combat trafficking in persons;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Information sharing
Data-collection capacity

textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the need for the systematic collection of disaggregated data including, as appropriate, in humanitarian responses, in line with do-no-harm principles, and in this regard *takes note* of the publication of the Global Report on Trafficking in Persons, prepared by the {{United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime}}, and the development of common methodologies and internationally defined indicators to make it possible to develop relevant and comparable figures, and *encourages* <<Governments>> to enhance [[information-sharing]] and [[data-collection capacity]] as a way of promoting cooperation to combat trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: Considered but excluded as deliverables (under non-directive verbs): 'systematic collection of disaggregated data' and 'development of common methodologies and indicators', since the paragraph is stressing/noting rather than tasking.

text: Encourages Governments, United Nations bodies, agencies and special mechanisms, intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations and the private sector to continue collaborative and joint research and studies on trafficking in women and girls that can serve as a basis for policy formulation or change;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Collaborative research and studies on trafficking in women and girls

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Governments>>, <<United Nations bodies>>, <<agencies>> and <<special mechanisms>>, <<intergovernmental>> and <<non-governmental organizations>> and the <<private sector>> to continue collaborative and joint [[research and studies]] on trafficking in women and girls that can serve as a basis for policy formulation or change;
uncertainties: "United Nations bodies" is broad; mapped to "Other (Other United Nations Bodies)" under UN Organs. "special mechanisms" is vague; kept as an 'other' assignee with the same phrase. "intergovernmental" is mapped to "international organizations" due to the combined phrase "intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations".

text: Invites Governments, with the support of the United Nations, when necessary, and other intergovernmental organizations, taking into account best practices, to formulate training manuals and other informational materials and to provide training for law enforcement, judicial and other relevant officials and medical and support personnel, with a view to sensitizing them to the special needs of women and girl victims and survivors of trafficking in persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: training manuals
informational materials
training

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<Governments>>, with the support of the {{United Nations}}, when necessary, and {{other intergovernmental organizations}}, taking into account best practices, to formulate [[training manuals]] and other [[informational materials]] and to provide [[training]] for law enforcement, judicial and other relevant officials and medical and support personnel, with a view to sensitizing them to the special needs of women and girl victims and survivors of trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: UN and other intergovernmental organizations are framed as supporters rather than direct addressees; treated as mentioned entities, not assignees.

text: Calls upon Governments, and encourages relevant intergovernmental bodies and international organizations, to ensure that military, peacekeeping and humanitarian personnel deployed in conflict, post-conflict and other emergency situations are provided with training on conduct that does not promote, facilitate or exploit trafficking in women and girls, including for sexual exploitation, and to raise the awareness of such personnel about the potential risks that victims of conflict and other emergency situations, including natural disasters, face of being subjected to trafficking in persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: training for deployed personnel on anti-trafficking conduct
awareness-raising for deployed personnel about trafficking risks
training for deployed personnel on anti-trafficking conduct
awareness-raising for deployed personnel about trafficking risks

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<Governments>>, and *encourages* relevant <<intergovernmental bodies>> and <<international organizations>>, to ensure that military, peacekeeping and humanitarian personnel deployed in conflict, post-conflict and other emergency situations are provided with [[training]] on conduct that does not promote, facilitate or exploit trafficking in women and girls, including for sexual exploitation, and to raise the [[awareness]] of such personnel about the potential risks that victims of conflict and other emergency situations, including natural disasters, face of being subjected to trafficking in persons;
uncertainties: "Intergovernmental bodies" is not a standard category in the entity list; treated as a separate 'other' assignee distinct from "international organizations". Classified "training" as capacity_building and "awareness" as information_sharing; both tasks seem to apply to all listed assignees.

text: Invites States parties to the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women, the Convention on the Rights of the Child, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights and the International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families to include information and disaggregated statistics on trafficking in women and girls as part of their national reports to the respective committees, as applicable;

text: Encourages States to continue to contribute to the United Nations voluntary trust fund on contemporary forms of slavery and to the United Nations voluntary trust fund for victims of trafficking in persons, especially women and children;

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its eighty-first session a report that presents information on successful interventions and strategies, as well as the gaps, in addressing the gender dimensions of the problem of trafficking in persons and provides recommendations on the strengthening of human rights-based, victim-centred and gender- and age-sensitive approaches within comprehensive, multidimensional, multicultural and balanced efforts to address trafficking in persons, including in the prosecution of traffickers and protection of victims.
